text: Eric James Stone (born 1967) is an American science fiction, fantasy, and horror author. He won the 2004 Writers of the Future contest,Writersofthefuture.com and has published in Analog Science Fiction and Fact, InterGalactic Medicine Show, and Jim Baen's Universe. His 2010 novelette, "That Leviathan, Whom Thou Hast Made," won the Nebula Award for Best Novelette and was a finalist for the Hugo Award.iO9 He became the assistant editor for Orson Scott Card's InterGalactic Medicine Show in 2009,Six Questions and served as web-host for Tangent Online. He received a degree in political science at Brigham Young UniversityEricjamesstone.com and went on to graduate from Baylor Law School.
